mung_beans_details.description: Mung beans, also known as green gram or golden gram, are small, green legumes native to the Indian subcontinent. They are widely cultivated for their edible seeds, which are a staple food in many cuisines.
mung_beans_details.nutritional value: Mung beans are rich in protein, dietary fiber, vitamins (especially folate and vitamin B6), and minerals (such as iron, magnesium, and potassium). They are low in fat and calories.
mung_beans_details.uses: Cooking (curries, soups, stews), Sprouting, Bean noodles, Flour production
mung_beans_details.varieties: Whole mung beans, Split mung beans, Sprouting mung beans

prerequisites.soil: Mung beans prefer well-drained sandy loam or loamy soil with good fertility.
prerequisites.climate: Mung beans thrive in warm climates with temperatures ranging from 70°F to 85°F (21°C to 29°C) during the growing season.
prerequisites.water: Mung beans require regular watering, keeping the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged.
prerequisites.frost: Mung beans are sensitive to frost and should be planted after the last frost date.
prerequisites.space: Plant mung bean seeds about 1 to 2 inches deep and 4 to 6 inches apart in rows spaced 12 to 18 inches apart.
